name: Blubird and The Memory Machine
description:
What time is it? My clock broke three weeks ago, so I've lost count...

Blubird is missing. I can't find him anywhere.

He gave me these VHS tapes, four of them, to be exact, but they don't make any sense. Just are full of random anagramic mysteries: a broken toy, a lost robot, a man who lost his eye, and a small locket. Something doesn't add up...

Look, typically I wouldn't be coming to you, but, Mason's been busy, E.C.H.O.'s away for the week, Indee has been out of the country, and even Yo-Yo seems to have made himself scarce.

So...

Will you help me?

----------------------------------------------

You play as a not-specifically-named temporary assistant of Steve, who is an inventor posing as an accountant in a town named Sunshine. Steve is asking you to help him with his newest invention: "THE MEMORY MACHINE," which in reality, is just a special VHS player. 

This game is a sequel to Blubird and the Golden Heart. Please play that first for the full experience, it isn't required, just heavily recommended. (Pst, you can get it here itch- https://coolblubird.itch.io/blubird-and-the-golden-heart or RPGmakerdotnet - https://rpgmaker.net/games/10957/ )

----------------------------------------------

Each "Memory" plays from a different scene that takes place around the events of the first game, including:

Memory 1: E.C.H.O.

E.C.H.O. is a semi-recently built robot by the same Steve you are working for.  The first memory goes into his first moments of existence. 

Memory 2: Blubird

Blubird is a young child living in the Artworth Forest with his parents. One night, a crash is heard by the lake, so Blu sets off with some friends (and whatever courage he can spare, trust me, he needs it) to find out what otherworldly terror crashed by the lake.

Memory 3: Damion Brody

Damion Brody is a bounty hunter with a failing blog living in Festival City. One day, he receives a request for help to find some blueprints inside of a large and mysterious building named "Last Hero Co." 

Memory 4: ???

...?

----------------------------------------------

This game features:

-Four chapters of game play, each with different main characters to play as, all from the previous game.

-Various humanoid races that populate a beautiful landscape.

-The charm and humor from the first game! But with better graphics! 

-oh, and there is combat,  I guess... I mean, it is an RPG, so...
